qas.question: Along with Somalo-Islamic architecture, what influences modern Somali architecture?
Along with the early modern and ancient, during what period did Somali architecture exist?
What material was used to make Somali cities?

context: Somali architecture is a rich and diverse tradition of engineering and designing. It involves multiple different construction types, such as <a2_0>stone<a2_0/> cities, castles, citadels, fortresses, mosques, mausoleums, towers, tombs, tumuli, cairns, megaliths, menhirs, stelae, dolmens, stone circles, monuments, temples, enclosures, cisterns, aqueducts, and lighthouses. Spanning the ancient, <a1_0>medieval<a1_0/> and early modern periods in Greater Somalia, it also includes the fusion of Somalo-Islamic architecture with <a0_0>Western designs<a0_0/> in contemporary times.
